meanings.definition: A person who shares the position of head or leader with another person.
meanings.sent1: In the group project, Sarah was the cohead along with John.
meanings.sent2: The cohead of the company made important decisions together.
meanings.sent3: The two friends decided to be coheads of their secret club.
meanings.sent4: Being a cohead is like having a partner in leadership.
meanings.sent5: The cohead role requires teamwork and cooperation.

meanings.definition: To serve as a cohead with someone else.
meanings.sent2: She coheads the committee meetings every month.
meanings.sent3: Let's cohead this project and make it a success!
meanings.sent4: Coheading the team allows for shared responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: He enjoys coheading projects as it fosters collaboration.
